definition: tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: That's why farmers cut and store their hay when it's dry.
sentences.chinese: 所以农民割完草要等草干才贮藏起来。

sentences.english: At that time it claims that it exaggerated, and now think, really got to be so dry.
sentences.chinese: 那时候还觉得夸张，现在想想，还真要这么干才行。

sentences.english: Sharp intention cures, utterly loyal, is a talented individual on the political.
sentences.chinese: 锐意图治，忠心耿耿，政治上是一位干才。

sentences.english: The president's quick of affairs and his energy astounded the staff.
sentences.chinese: 总裁的干才和精力都让我们惊异。

sentences.english: Subordinating everything to the war effort means just this.
sentences.chinese: 必须这样干才叫做服从战争。

sentences.english: We'll have to work very hard to catch the other company up.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须努力干才能够赶上另一家公司。

sentences.english: Therefore, the nine fort towns were set up to defend the frontier, where some defending talents showed themselves.
sentences.chinese: 明设九镇防边，一批戍边干才脱颖而出。

sentences.english: This is not easy, and may require two porpoises working together.
sentences.chinese: 这并非易事，可能需要两只海豚合伙干才行。

sentences.english: Yes, the administration needed experienced hands.
sentences.chinese: 没错，政府需要有经验的干才。

sentences.english: He is looking ahead, to when his fields are dry enough that he can start planting.
sentences.chinese: 他正展望未来，当他的田地足够干才可以开始种植。

definition: to preserve the accomplishments of previous generations/to carry on the good work of one's predecessors
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
to take an official post/to become a government employee
by brute strength/rashly and forcefully/bull-headed/to work tenaciously with no fear of hardship
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
to promote/to reinstate (in a position or job)
